Our entree came to the table 5 minutes before the movie was to begin so we asked for it to be served in the theatre. The GM brought the plate to us and unfortunately the stuffed shrimp was cold. While we waited for the dinner in the theatre the server took our drink order and during the move brought my wife her drink and never returned with mine. She didn't come back until it was time for the check. To top it off while we waited for our car the group next to us was talking about their experience and how three of the four dinners came out wrong. The Managment was very concerned and attentive but for the prices we paid for a movie and dinner this did not come close to my expectations nor did it for the people standing next to us waiting for our cars.

I expected a great meal for valentine's day.Made reservations a week in advance.  When we arrived we were sitted at a table in the bar area.. Not very romantic.  When we asked for tea they were out. As far as the the menu we not were impressed. We left there hungry.. Definitely  will not go back.. Was not worth the $80.00 bill..
We had a blast and the food was off the chain, service was great thanks to our server Jill she made sure and the food plus drinks were perfect.!!!

For a "high end restaurant" Tanzy fell short on several points.  First off the music was way too loud and I was sitting next to my wife and had to talk louder than normal for her to hear me.  The salad was good but had to rush to eat it because our entrees arrived before we were finished.  We both ordered the fillet which was cooked perfectly but the potatoes were almost raw and the three pieces of asparagus were too smoky tasting. Once again the desserts arrived before my wife was 3/4 finished with her entr√©e so the dessert sat for about ten minutes before we were ready to eat it.  The whole night we felt rushed to hurry and eat and leave.

Love it!  Great atmosphere, awesome drinks, and the house made mozzarella is one of my new favorite dishes of all time.  The bartenders do a great job, and are super friendly.  The only downside is that they don't have a happy hour, but they do have $3 drinks on Tuesdays.  Go and check it out!
Awesome!!! Our server Jill was AMAZING!!! had great food & the atmosphere is beautiful!!

I was here for The Breakfast Club.  Were were seated along the South window above the courtyard.  The dining room itself was really nice. Those in our group from the East Valley were delayed up to a half hour for road construction and they didn't bat an eyelash.  Service was spot on the whole time.  I had a prix fixe special of a chicken entree on fried gnocchi with Parmesan fries and a Tanzy salad.  It was all excellent.  Even in Scottsdale, if the salad had been $14 instead of included I thought it would be over priced.

An all around eclectic experience,  Tanzy's staff provided spectacular eats and shining service giving them five stars across the board.  Coop was very down to earth, hospitable, and exhumed a heir of confidence  that allowed for my husband and I to have a comfortable evening; feeling that we were in good hands.  Not to forget the fresh mozz, prosciutto, and spiced fig paired with volcanic black salt and EVOO followed by two very delectable, and decently portioned entrees. Needless to say, my husband and I left Tanzy with two very happy palates.  The prices are what one would expect from a four star establishment,  but it is well worth it, especially for the overall quality that is received.

For August Breakfast Club the place picked was Tanzy, I for one was pretty excited about it! I didn't even know they were opened for bunch so when I got a look at the bunch menu I knew I was sold!  Tanzy does offer a prix fixe bunch menu for $22 that comes with a lot of options, but they also have a breakfast menu too. After checking out both menus I knew what I wanted.   I went with the traditional eggs benedict. It was the perfect dish, with the right amount of hollandaise sauce; I just love that golden yellow tangy sauce! Yum! The eggs were cooked perfectly, the smoked Canadian ham was tender and moist, not dry and the English muffin was cooked perfectly too, firm and yet able to be cut when taking bite.  This was a great dish, can't wait to come back and try it again! The only down side to this breakfast was I wasn't able to get a order of the crispy Brussels sprouts, as it was too early to order them.   Service was great; the restaurant is an opened lay out and nice, it even has great views of the valley. If you are in the area, regardless if it's for breakfast or dinner, give Tanzy a try! And if it's for dinner, do the crispy Brussels sprouts, man they are delish!
Awesome food, service and atmosphere! Great wine selection as well.  Will be back as soon as I'm in the area again.   Well done Tanzy!

My wife and I have been frequenting Tanzy for Sunday brunch for the last couple of years. We tend to come in every other week, but more often during football season as the bartenders are very accommodating in tuning into the game you would like to watch. The brunch menu is fairly extensive and we typically enjoy the brown sugar spiced bacon as our appetizer. Some of the entr√©es I would recommend would be the build your own omelet, blueberry pancakes and the 10oz Tanzy burger. With the recent addition of the Social Hour menu, more sharable options are now available and they have added a 5oz black and blue burger which is fantastic and lighter on the waistband then its 10oz brunch counterpart.  Now to be fair there are many brunch destinations in Scottsdale and North Phoenix, but what makes Tanzy truly special is the staff. With so many restaurants available, what makes any restaurant worth frequenting these days is the staff members you enjoy interacting with and the exceptional service they provide. With that being said, Shay has been one of our favorite bartenders. She remembered us from our first brunch experience with her and knew us by name on our next meeting. She is always quick with a smile when she sees us come in and greets us with enthusiasm. She genuinely seems to enjoy her work and is a pleasure to dine with. We will continue to highly recommend Tanzy to our friends and family as not only because of the wonderful brunch options, but as a place where providing personal service and attention to your customers still means something.

I came here with a large group of people, there were 13 of us total. We originally were planning on going to True Food- it would have have been a 90 min wait there so that's how we ended up at Tanzy. Tanzy was able to seat us right away which was great!   The decor and ambience of the establishment is modern and upscale. But let's talk about what's really important-  the food!  My friend and I shared the lobster salad and pasta with mushrooms and were we glad we did cause the portions were quite generous!  By sharing, we were able to enjoy two different dishes at the just right portions.  The lobster salad was simply delicious with a very light dressing that gave just the right amount of flavoring to the dish. And there were plenty of lobster pieces in the salad too.  The pasta with mushroom dish was also delicious. I should be more honest- it was scrumlicious!!!!  Generally with this type of pasta dishes, there's usually a heavy sauce to give the pasta flavor or else the pasta is flavorless. Not with this dish. The pasta was cooked perfectly and cooked with just the right amount of sauce without it being heavy. I'm not sure how the chef got the flavor to stick to the pasta. Needless to say, I ate every last piece of pasta on my plate! I sneaked a peek at the other dishes, they all looked delicious and well presented.  Service was excellent. And they will split the shared dishes for you before bringing the entrees out to your table.  I went in there with no expectations and left a very happy costumer and am looking forward to going back to try out the other entrees!

Great place for drinks awesome happy hour great bar service.  I don't understand why it takes so long to get something so simple but the atmosphere is spectacular. I'll still come back but they really need to revamp the menu and fix the service.  If Tanzy had food and service like AZ88 it would be a gold mine.

Love the food, love the atmosphere, and service was fast and the staff knowledgeable. If only there was a movie theater next door where I could go watch a movie after dinner... Oh wait, there is!! I'll for sure be back!

Great brunch spot! 4 mimosas for $10.. Can't beat that! Food was great... I had the poached eggs and my friend had an omelette. The fruit that was served was very fresh. The poached eggs had a truffle sauce and a side of artichokes with prosciutto! Delish!! I will be coming back for brunch and I need to try dinner!

I really like this place.  This is a great place to have lunch or happy hour drinks.  It's located at the Scottsdale Quarter right next to a very nice iPic movie theater, so it's convenient for pre/post movie cocktails as well.  Lunch is my favorite time to come.  The Prosciutto di Parma Ciabatta and the Turkey Panini are two of my favorite dishes.  They're both only $10 ea and comes with Parmesan Fries, which are addicting...yum!  The lunch crowd here is relatively light for Scottsdale, which means you'll get in/out pretty fast.  Service here is always very good.  Return Factor - 90%

Reservation was made for 4 of us for a birthday celebration. No reservation was needed! Lounge was packed, restaurant not so much. This was our first and last time here. Questioned a particular vodka, server stated not available and never heard of it, of course after she served our drinks, she appeared with the vodka in hand, humbled. We began with the tableside mozzarella to share, was pretty decent, however, before we were 1/2 through, our entrees appeared. Seriously? What happened to dining? Not like they needed the table for the next party, plenty were available, 6:30pm reservation and we were out by 7:45pm. Has anyone ever seen rolled monkfish? Looked like two turds on my plate, had to use a knife to cut so tough and chewy, no I didn't send it back, not worth it. Monkfish is to be silky and smooth, almost like halibut. How about calamari served with capers? That's a first for us. Tuna Tartare? Tasteless. I will say the Tiramasu that the birthday boy ordered was ok and nice touch to include it. Don't waste your time or your money!

We took my husband and father out for brunch on Fathers day. We were seated right away which was great. We requested the back room and thats where we were seated. there wasnt a lot of choices for brunch so we are hoping to come back on a regular night to order from the main menu. it seemed like the food did take a while to come out and it was just 4 adults and a child eating. it was pretty good just wish there were more choices.

Best Italian diner ever. Fine dining but without the cost. I found the menu items very reasonably priced considering the other fine dining restaurants I've been to. Also the customer service is phenomenal. Tyne server Josh was beyond accommodating and anticipated our needs perfectly what a great server! Also the manager Jarome stopped by our table numerous times to ensure our experience was beyond enjoyable. Thank you to the entire Tanzy team and great food!!

We decided to try Tanzy on Easter Sunday. I had made us reservations and found that was the right way to go! The place is beautiful but hard to find at Scottsdale Quarters. Park in one of the garages available or valet park and walk. The restaurant is on the second level next to Ipic studios. Take the escalator or elevator upstairs.  They can accommodate large groups or an intimate meal for two. We went for the lunch box breakfast option at $19.99 a person.  I had the eggs Benedict with salmon and asparagus and hubby chose the omelet option. With a side of the bacon "flight" which is extra it was a wonderful meal. The make it yourself Bloody Mary bar was nice as part of the meal. Our waiter Adrian was busy but attentive and our interactions with the Easter bunny were fun. A special occasion place but a great way to have a great dining experience!

Awesome steak salad with delicious ripe vine tomatoes!  I really like the big booths and comfortable modern decor. It also has a great bar! This place is upstairs located next to the IPic Theater. We would have never tried it, but we were told that it would be a 45 min wait at True Food downstairs so we decided to check it out!  The dinner menu looked great, so we will have to check that out another time. I am glad we came here and I would definitely go back!!

Are here last night. Staff is super friendly and on top of it!! They comp'd our mozzarella appetizer for being a little bit late. It wasn't that delayed so it was very nice of them to do. I highly recommend getting one of the fresh table side mozzarella appetizers!  So good with the pink Himalayan salt!! For entree I had the Branzino...it was perfect.
Great atmosphere and service! Happy hour only goes till 6 though which kind of sucks.

I've been here many times for a working lunch. They have free wifi, and booths near the window have views outside so it can be a relaxing, quiet place to get work done. For food, I usually get either the smoked turkey or the CBLT sandwich, which have always been pretty good. The staff has always been friendly and attentive. The happy hour wine is a great deal, and a very generous pour! Its located next to the iPic, so you can grab dinner before heading in to see a movie.

So let me get this straight...you have reverse Happy Hour that starts at 10pm and your hostess locks the door and starts her clean up at 1015pm? There was hardly anyone in the bar except for friends of the wait staff and bar tender in which they were all sitting over with them. Now I know it wasn't busy, but a little unprofessional. How about the management gets with the picture and starts to do things to get new life into that place before they have to close their doors. The reverse Happy Hour specials were ok...but they need to include all their signature cocktails instead of just three.

I went with a small group of people Sunday evening to Tanzy; we figured we'd give it a try. Great ambiance; we felt like we were in a Las Vegas restaurant. The server Isaiah waited on us. Cordial, professional, yet still had a friendly approach that made us feel at home. The shrimp was fantastic. Beyond fantastic. The scallops were some of the best scallops we've had. I thought my bolognese was a bit heavy on the rosemary side, my friends disagreed. But regardless, Isaiah was quick to offer me a replacement entree. The attention we received by our server, along with delicious food, will certainly get us coming back here again. Ask for Isaiah. I just met him Sunday and already I feel like I know who to request when I return. He won't steer you wrong.

Went there a couple of days ago. Caprese was great! Wife got the ravioli, and didn't care for it. I had the ribeye, and was over cooked. $48 for what is basically an Applebee's steak. Don't waste your money.

Wowwwww.... from Top to flop and back to absolutely TOP..  And the absolut TOP parts that's ot how I/ we knew and experienced Tanzy in the past and now again. First of all, your costumer service was amazing and took my/ our complaint very serious. Super management!!! Now, after quite a while we returned to your place, on a Saturday evening...  And to make it short, we had the full amazing experience what your place is famous for... nice service and great food. Everything was on point. We ordered the Ribeye steak and Braised Pork Shoulder... both main dishes were extremely tasty, and just to die for. For starter we ordered the grilled calamari: super  soft, great taste, just wonderful. At the end it was a fantastic dinner experience. Thanks for everything... and YES we are coming back for sure!!!
Beautiful restaurant.  Loved the table side mozzarella/pesto. Such a great idea.  Staff was attentive and nice. Drinks.......yum.

Good food but so loud you can't talk so perhaps it's just for blind dates. Table side mozz is fun but takes 20-25 minutes. Interesting list but staff isn't trained on it. Had a French Orin swift we stumbled on that  was good - definitely not a relaxing quiet Italian dinner place.  My ears hurt!  Yet food was good

Great and classy place!! Located on 2nd floor of Sdale Quarter (adjacent to iPic). NOTE: park in the garage by Brio, or valet - I believe Tanzy validates parking.  I had heard rave reviews of Tanzy, but had my own personal bias w/the name. You see, I was raised on a farm in SW Washington and "tansy" was a menacing weed that was cursed under one's breath in the spring. I personally thought the weed was quite charming (beautiful, yellow flowers)...but my grandparents thought differently.  Tanzy didn't disappoint! It was late afternoon so the staff rolled back the walls and the lounge area was completely al fresco. Nice breeze on the tropical sofas while watching the tops of the palms sway in the wind. Felt like I was on a damn vacation.  I had a cucumber-lime martini (delish, but a tad on sweet side) and their calamari. OMG! Soooo good! My friend had their fries and they were quite impressive also - unique tasting and love that they were put in like a little, silver "fry basket". Nice touch!!  Service was impeccable and attentive. Tanzy, you won my heart and have changed up my personal bias - thank you!!
The drink selection is amazing...I feel like im in new york. Service is off the charts. Staff is so accommodating.  The food phenomenal. Im in love New York!!!!!
The jaz duo in the bar was delightfull  Service team was timely, professional and knowledgable  Gluten free options were good  in a word "Enjoyable"
Amazing new menu !! Filet was good but the flat skirt steak was one of the best juiciest steak I have ever experienced!! Well done Tandy  See you again soon

Overpriced drinks and an appetizer costs up $55. Seriously. The place is cool, hence the 3 stars. The door is like something out of a movie and the glass and lighting are really neat. I say you save this for a date when you wont be paying. I was not on that at the time. The bartender was okay, kept getting into conversations with other staff that lasted too long. Our drinks, while way too expensive, were unique and delicious.

My husband and I have been to Tanzy twice now. The first experience was for their prix fix Valentine menu which was broken into four courses.  The first course was a choice of parma tasting or caprese. My husband and I both ordered the parma tasting. This consisted of 3 meats - prosciutto, capicola and one other. There were also three sauces to try. Overall, I wasn't very impressed with this and didn't finish it.   The second course was a choice of lobster bisque or Tanzy house salad. My husband and I both chose the lobster bisque. It was delicious and one of the better bisques we've had. (My husband is a huge fan of lobster bisque and gets it at most restaurants.) There were large chunks of lobster in it, which was a treat.   The main course was a choice of filet mignon, lobster tail, pan-seared seabass or a surf and turf (1/2 lobster tail and filet mignon). My husband and I both ordered the surf and turf. Both of our filets were cooked perfectly medium rare. The side of mashed potatoes was good, but nothing to write home about. The lobster on the other hand was very tasty.   The dessert was a choice of red velvet bread pudding, a chocolate torte, or a date cake. My husband ordered the bread pudding and I ordered the chocolate torte. The bread pudding was amazing. Super tender and flavorful. I would definitely order this again. The chocolate torte was just okay. I really wish I ordered the bread pudding instead.   Overall, we enjoyed being able to sample many menu items and would give this experience four stars.  Our second experience was for lunch. We came on a Sunday around brunch time and had to decide if we wanted breakfast or lunch. Their breakfast sounded good and everyone around us had delicious looking entrees. However, we opted for lunch. I ordered the club and my husband went with the cheeseburger.   My club was ridiculous and I had to deconstruct it and put it back together before I could actually eat it. First, it had three layers of bread. I removed one layer and also took out the fried egg. (Who puts fried egg on a club?) The egg by itself was tasty but I didn't want it on my club. Next, I had to rearrange the avocado so that it made a layer instead of just sitting in one clump. Then, I had to remove the iceberg lettuce because that overpowered the sandwich. (Again, iceberg? Romaine would have been much better and more appreciated.) Then to top it all off, the turkey was dry. The only good thing about my meal was the parmesan fries.  My husband's burger looked delicious but was a large disappointment. The meat itself was extremely flavorless and the bacon was chewy. The bun was extremely large and after a while, my husband just gave up and took the bun off and ate the burger with a fork/knife. Again, the only good thing about the meal was the parmesan fries.  Overall, it wasn't a good lunch and I would give this experience two stars. Add the two experiences together and it evens out to three stars. However, I'm not sure if we'll be back.

I want to like Tanzy for more than what it is. The restaurant has a great vibe. It's a place where you want to have a date, or a get-together with friends, or a fabulous bite after shopping or pre-movie because of how the place looks. However, the food is a let-down. It is an extremely basic menu with a pricey upcharge. I've eaten at Tanzy several times and the only thing on the menu that kept me going was the calamari starter. However, they changed the dish and it fails to compare.  It was divine before, and now it is a basic dish. I do have to give it kudos on customer service. That has always been up to snuff. The final verdict for this place: A great place to have a drink.

The last few times I have been to Tanzy's things have been welllll not good... not good at all. You have this beautiful space adjacent to Ipic theatre, which is a high end movie theatre for those not in the know. I usually grab a drink or two or a meal before a movie here but after the last few visits never again.  Service is always spotty (yesterday was no exception, the only saving grace was a nice Midwest fellow who went out of his way to give us a good experience). As I was sitting at the bar, I looked up at the shelves and kinda lost my appetite when I noticed the insane amount of dust on the bottles on the shelves and really the shelves themselves, It made me wonder if it's that dusty and dirty in the front of the house, what does the back of the house look like?  Food was terrible, French onion soup was flavorless and sickeningly sweet and there was hardly any cheese... French Onion soup is all about the cheese and rich robust flavors. Don't even get me started on the calamari, the texture of it was almost like chewing on cardboard paper, the sauce that the calamari is served on was delicious though. For a few cocktails and a couple bad appetizers that put me out $57.00 plus tip it makes me feel like I was robbed.
We checked this place out while in the area. The food was good, and there was some live jazz. I had the meatballs and Kale salad (avoiding carbs). I'd go back and try some other dishes.

Food is great, bartenders have been always understanding and pour well, I have never had an issue with the waitstaff or food. I have been to this restaurant more than 15 times since moving to Scottsdale 2 years ago.

It's hard to give this place two stars, because I really like the atmosphere here. However, the service was lacking and has been for quite some time now. I don't get to go out much during the week, so I always count on a good meal and good service when going out during the weekend with a group of friends. The past few times I've been here, I've been more than disappointed with the service, despite the consistent chances I've given this place. Our server said "no" or "I don't believe so" or "I will have to check to see if we still have that available" or "I think we are out"- it was absolutely horrible!! She didn't know anything. On top of that, our food came out all at random times, in no order, over an HOUR and we ordered everything at the same time. These were just simple appetizers! I'm sad to say this because I really believe this place has so much potential with its location- but with the continuous lack of service I've received over time, I will not be back.

My friend and I went to Tanzy tonight for happy hour. Little did we know that it was ladies night at Tanzy. We were informed when we arrived that ladies night meant that we received half off of the happy hour menu. I'm surprised they wouldn't gladly advertise this on their website as the restaurant was slow the duration of the time we were there (other than the private party).   We ordered two cocktails, 4 glasses of wine and two appetizers for $27. It was a phenomenal deal considering their normal prices and the amount of food and drinks that we received. We ordered the Ratatouille pizza and it was great!  We would highly recommend this dish.   A few gripes that we had though: the chips that came with the quinoa & spinach dip were way under done. The chips were almost chewy. It ruined the dip for us. The service was also pretty slow. We sat at the bar. There were two bartenders with only about 8-10 people at the bar for the entire 2.5 hours that we were there. They did have a private party going on so maybe they should've staffed up behind the bar.   Of course we were very happy with the pricing but I would not come back during a non happy hour for the lower level of service with higher prices.

An amazing experience.  The location is great, atmosphere is incredible, friendly employees and our group of 9 were very impressed with the food.  The halibut special was one of the best I have ever had.  Great for a romantic night out or for a group.  I will be returning, it was hard to choose what to order on the menu because it all looked good.

I'm pretty sure I was had while dining here.  When I received the bill the wrong drinks were on there which were almost $10 more than what I had ordered and the list price on the menu for another was less than the bill price.    This place feels like it is run by someone whose dream was to run a restaurant but has no idea what they are doing.  If you are going to charge the prices you do then the service needs to reflect that.  After speaking to 3 different people we finally received drinks.  We watched 3 other tables that had been seated after us receive their appetizers before receiving ours.  Our waitress actually came over and asked us if we had received it yet as if we were in charge of the situation!!!  The food is meh.  They have a hysterical dessert cart... why??????  This is so awkward.  Just give me my dessert, clearly your staff are overwhelmed why are they also pastry chefs and need to make a show of it?  On top of this its an Italian restaurant with NO TIRAMISU.  The shame!  Trust the reviews on Yelp that the service here is consistently horrible and stay home and order pizza!

The service was great! But the food was less than "okay". Meatballs tasted like chef boyardee, the fries were crumbs, and the calamari was cold. Not a soul in sight on a Saturday night. Past its prime and to spend over $100 just to hear that the kitchen shared its menus with a movie theater? Go to Olive Garden for a better time.

Karen reached out to me with a post on Yelp, I forwarded her my phone and email address as she requested.  Sad to say that she never contacted or reached out to me.  Sad to say, I'll be finding another place for my corporate events and a new place to host friends/family.

This is a really simple one,  the food was better than expected.  Jay our server was great and took care of business and left us alone until needed.   Ask for Jay! I had the Caesar salad with lemon dressing and guest had linguini with shrimp which was at the perfect temperature and so yummy,  I forgot to take picture. :-)  Perfect night out and walk around downtown.  ALSO REMEMBER YOU CAN GET VALET RECEIPT VALIDATED.
Great place to grab some drinks around the fire! I recently discovered Tanzy, and I wish I had been going here all along! Great late night food menu as well. Highly recommend!
My wife and I had a great evening at Tanzy on New Years Eve.  The restaurant is beautiful with a cool, sophisticated vibe.  The service and food were excellent.   We will definitely be back!

Met a friend here yesterday before a movie.  I actually arrived first, around 5:50 pm, told the bartender I was waiting for a friend who was going to join me at a 6:15 pm movie and asked if I could order the Table-side Mozzarella For Two to take with us.  He said there wouldn't be enough time to order the app, but that we could order apps on the happy hour menu list and take those, so I chose the calamari and the meatballs, which were $8 each.  The calamari smelled fishy (not the sea-fresh scent) and had terrible texture, as if it was undercooked. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tanzy-scottsdale?start=100&select=Kdc4C3svJf6R7QmXrGo5ZQ#Kdc4C3svJf6R7QmXrGo5ZQ  The meatballs were good, albeit on the smallish side**, with a nice dollop of ricotta cheese, but the dish wasn't accompanied by any crostini, unlike my previous orders, which were admittedly a year, or more ago. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tanzy-scottsdale?start=100&select=nNFXqb2B8vN8envJcgRl7g#nNFXqb2B8vN8envJcgRl7gI  I asked for a little bread, but didn't have time to wait for it as we had to leave for the movie.    Don't know if I'd order the meatballs again, especially since the crostini were omitted, but my friend and I will be back to try the Mozzarella for two soon.  **This is what the meatball crostini app looked like in March 2013! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tanzy-scottsdale?select=9aiYhoNUaF_nJWOkYu-yjg#9aiYhoNUaF_nJWOkYu-yjg  #740

Gorgeous!!!  Food- eh, its OK ...as weird as it is to say this.. try the Brussels sprouts  Bar- Tom the bartender makes this place worth going to all by himself. hes over the top fun!! Good drinks fast!   I have been here several times and even though I didn't care for i at first they seem to be improving all of the things that seem to be off. Now even offering a complementary hummus bar during happy hour( which was not previously offered)

Great spot for a first date! Valet the slab and walk on up, great drink selection and very inviting appetizers.  The staff is very friendly, get a little toasted here and head on home, it's game over! This place is a must try.

Had a lovely Mommies Night Out here recently. A great venue for sharing some wine (recommend the NZ Sauvignon Blanc) and some delicious appetizers! The warm mozzarella was amazing ... love how it is prepared right in front of you. The atmosphere was nice and cozy, the music was good and at a level that allowed you to still be able to talk to one another and the service was wonderful.

This restaurant always has the most amazing staff! I love love love the fresh table side mozzarella , the bruschetta board teeming with fresh berries, marcona almonds, a varied selection of cheese, fig spread and other seasonal accoutrements. It's so fun to have a cocktail before the movie , a few appetizers and if you don't finish either you can bring it to the theater with you!

I went here for brunch with my hubby last weekend as part of the fabulous Monica O.'s monthly breakfast club. This is probably one of the more expensive breakfasts we have had as a group but it was also in one of the nicer establishments. Scottsdale Quarter is a pretty high brow shopping center and Tanzy lives up to this locale. Lots of dark wood, gorgeous stone and metal finishes, and lovely chandeliers. It is a pretty nice looking place.  To eat, I had a spinach omelette which was cooked perfectly. I also had the gouda hash browns which weren't as delicious as I thought they would be. I am not really sure what was off about them but I think I preferred the rosemary potatoes that came with my husband's meal. He ordered the steak and eggs since he loves getting that at most breakfast places. At Tanzy instead of a typical breakfast strip steak the meal included filet which is a great cut of meat but there just wasn't enough of it. Also, even though the description mentioned English muffins it did not specify that it would be served up like a McMuffin sandwich. He wasn't too thrilled about that. The most cost efficient part of the meal was their great deal on 4 mimosas for $10. They were mostly juice but still tasted great. You will definitely want to take advantage of this, especially in light of the fact that THEY CHARGE $5 FOR A GLASS OF SODA. The server never came by to give my husband a refill so that was pretty annoying to pay that much for a single glass of soda.  I might stop in here for brunch again if I were going to see a movie at ipic (which we did) but I wouldn't drive out of my way to eat here.

Totally a cool place wish San Fran had a place like this. The food was fresh reasonable we shared a bottle mascoto really a great bottle . We had the calamari grilled with Caesar salad then we shared a meal and of course dessert. The service was amazing. The atmosphere breath taking , the whole package was breath taking. This area is really cute

Absolutely, gorgeous set up. Meet some friends for happy hour.  Tuesday is one cent martinis! Three to choose from. Jeannie tried the pineapple-jalape√±o and the citrus martini. She enjoyed the citrus one the most, but did like the pin-jal one also.  I had a couple of $4 Stellas.  Had great service and look forward to a return visit. Think they have something called wine down Wednesdays , where they have 1/2 off on bottles and wine reps doing tastings...need to check it out!
By far, the best restaurant in Scottsdale Quarter and an amazing place for special events.

Stopped by for my first time for a last minute date night with my boyfriend yesterday and the food was phenomenal! We were greeted by the manager, Dayna. She was so sweet and extremely welcoming. Our server, Abigail was very knowledgeable of the menu. I was unsure of what to order on the menu so she helped me out and I ended up getting the Tuscan Kale salad with grilled salmon and my boyfriend got the gulf shrimp and grits.... YUM! The atmosphere was so relaxing, and the employees are so attentive. It's also such a cool place to eat at before you catch a movie, only because it's also attached to iPic theaters! Be sure to ask for Abigail or Dayna when you come in! They'll make it worth your time. :)

Went to Tanzy for birthday dinner last Saturday and it was amazing! The fresh table order mozzarella was the appetizer of choice for everyone in our party. Chef Press and his crew brought out a surprise pasta carbonara course and there is no way I can recreate that at home.. we muscled our way through our main course but still had room for dessert! Thank you to Chef Press and his front and back of the house team!
Such a great place to hang out...bartenders are all fabulous. Haven't tried food there, but the atmosphere is fantastic and so are the drinks!

Everything here is fantastic.  The atmosphere leaves nothing to be desired, the wine list is amazing, and the food?  Yum!  I'm especially partial to the tableside mozzarella and have brought many friends with me to try it.

For a restaurant to have a specific prix fixe menu on thanksgiving that is taking reservations I would have expected a little more organization. We waited 10-15 mins before getting seated with reservations.  We waited another 10-12 minutes before we even got greeted at our table. Once we ordered drinks they sat at the bar for another 10-15 minutes. We never got waters, garnishes in drinks (even after being told they'd come), never got second round of drinks had to walk to the bar to ask for them. The time between courses was unbelievably long. The food was cold.  It was VERY disappointing for a $45/pp menu. Especially after being told everything was made in a huge batch but yet we still waited a considerable amount of time. I understand that it is a holiday but for a restaurant to have a knowledge of number of guests and prix fixe the service and quality was terrible.

Mixed feelings tonight...The food was excellent, as usual.  I was VERY dissapointed that the only dairy free desert was sorbet.  The waiters were quite confused all night...One started to do a mozarella presentation.  We had to stop him to say we didn't order that.  Someone dropped a plate of short ribs on a table...Sorry but we didn't order that either!  Hubby started eating his desert only to realize it was the wrong one.  Sorry Tanzy, tonight just wasn't your night, ours neither! This visit was not typical, maybe because it was friday the 13th and Valentine's weekend.  The staff were very nice but extremely confused! The food was delicious.

Had the distinct pleasure of having dinner here tonight. Although we live in Scottsdale, my husband and I are frequent travelers and  have dined out in restaurants throughout the United States. Our waiter, Adrian, was the best waiter we've ever had.  Service was phenomenal, as well as his knowledge of the food/desserts.  His warm and gracious personality and attention to detail was outstanding.  The food was excellent (including the table side mozzarella) and the wait time between appetizers and the meal was excellent. We will definitely return here soon. Thank you, Tanzy and staff, for a great evening.

Very beautiful space. Also located close to shops which is nice. We came during happy hour, where prices were pretty reasonable. I found it interesting that the feel is very lounge like, lots of couches and comfortable furniture. We were greeted right away, and the person taking care of us did a great job of managing our large group. The appetizers here were very good, we tried several. Check this place out for a chill vibe and great service.

I've eaten here a few times and haven't been impressed. The food is over priced and just ok. The last time we had dinner here the service was terrible and our server gave us the impression she's rather be someplace else. We won't be returning and certainly wouldn't recommend.

We used to go there a lot on Tuesday for HH and did so tonight before a movie and the waiter/bartender was horrible! We asked about HH specials and he just gave us a blank stare so we just said we'd have the house wines, which he neglected to tell us one wasn't on special, that the house wine was 10 bucks. Just rude! No one was friendly there and the food has never really been great. I rather eat at ipic! Of course they don't care about reviews so think about going to another place in the area before this one. We never see anyone there and they always act like they are sooo busy   Updated!!! The Manager Peter said for us to come back in and he gave us our meal and drinks complimentary and everything was great and he even let us order off iPic menu since we didn't feel like breakfast. Everyone was super friendly and welcoming! Great stop before a movie. They've redone the place and it looks beautiful!

I came here to eat while waiting for my showtime at the Scottsdale IPIC Theater. It is a little on the pricey side but I enjoyed it. I had a rib eye sandwich and it was very good. It was lunch time and it was not very crowded on a Tuesday. The service was great and the waiter took the time to explain which were his favorites and why they were his favorites. He cared about us and it made us feel welcomed. I will definitely try this place again when in the area.
Visited the first day it opened and still a repeat customer. Ask for the cucumber jalapeno martini (secret menu item me and the bartender know).
Great cocktails and ambience! Good date spot!

My husband and I just came home from my birthday dinner at Tanzy.  Our server, Heidi, took an excellent care of us.  Perfect ambiance, tasteful decor, and delightful entrees.  We are so pleased to find such a gem in our neighborhood.  We plan to return soon with our friends and family!!
Service terrible. Was at this restaurant for 2 hours waiting and waiting for brunch. Not busy at all either.  Tarimasu was soggy. Food was decent.  Don't sit in the bar. Learned a lesson here

I'd been wanting to check out Tanzy for a while now, after hearing about the beautiful decor and awesome cocktails.  I likes me an awesome cocktail in beautiful surroundings in the springtime.  With those things in mind, I decided a Wednesday Happy Hour would be a good time for the first visit; knowing that Tanzy doesn't really have Happy Hour specials, and OK with that in order to get a well crafted cocktail and equivalent bites to go with.  They were almost empty at that hour, and there must've been 20+ people working the place.  I assume prepping for an evening rush(?).  We ended up with two servers competing for our table who, when they took their passive-aggressive discussion four feet away, were still very audible to us.  I found myself hoping for a full-on catfight as surprise entertainment for the evening.  But, alas, the bigger and louder of the two won out.  This aggressive tone turned out to be a common theme throughout our visit - in how everything was described as nothing short of Nirvana, in how a full entree was pushed on us when we only asked about the side that came with the entree, in being informed that the portions of a $28 short rib entree wouldn't be enough for two of us to share, in the smiles so unnaturally big they looked like they hurt, in how the server described the restaurant's concept as "very Scottsdale".  Hark - do I smell desperation?  Now, that's something we long-time Phoenix/Scottsdale residents know well as we see restaurants come and go in the blink of an eye.  My dining partner insited we place bets right then and there on how long Tanzy will be around.  Did I enjoy my experience at Tanzy?  Well, no, because of what I think was just an off night for service, and because the cocktails and food we ordered didn't measure up to the hype.  I'll for sure give them another chance - it truly is a beautiful restaurant and does appear to have professional, very hard working people that can make whatever adjustments are needed - if they are needed.  (My opinion might just be that - my opinion alone)  We can never have too many great places in Scottsdale, and I sincerely hope Tanzy is one of those great places that makes it here.  To get me on board, it's just going to need to tone down the attitude.

Today I got to experience brunch at Tanzy.. I've been here before for happy hour.. we started our day with mimosas (yum!).. they have a short but not simple brunch menu..   I had the poached egg, mascarpone polenta, short ribs & kale w/bacon. The polenta was creamy goodness, paired beautifully with the slow cooked tender short ribs and the caramalized goodness of the kale &bacon.   My gf got the steak & eggs.. it came with potatoes & toast..   Since we weren't ready to go and they weren't serving dessert yet.. we split the monkey bread and had coffees with Baileys .. the monkey bread was like a crusty muffin (weird) until you break it up into pieces and pour chocolate sauce all over it .. that's how it's meant to be enjoyed!!   Overall great experience even with a new waitress in training the bartender did his best to get around to make sure we didn't need anything else ..

We have been here twice as part of a large group. (14-20 people) and we have had excellent service. they are always prepared and assign multiple servers to our table. The food was excellent, and the tableside mozzarella with truffle oil was also amazing. We will definitely be using this place for future dinners. We are so impressed with the crew at Tanzy!

Crab cake was so tiny and super salty.. I wanted eat them because it was $16 but too salty to eat them. Folk was dirty and drink was not worth of $13.. it used to be nice restaurant but quality went down but price is still high.

Probably one of the worst experiences I have had at any restaurant and I didn't even get to eat the food. We decide to eat at the bar and the hostess does not even give us menus, because she is running around the whole restaurant when there is a line waiting to be seated. Then I grab two menus by myself and don't get greeted for 15 minutes then 5 minutes later we get waters , then we wait another five minutes until we decide to leave . It is such a shame that such a beautiful restaurant is so understaffed . This is not the first time I heard about this happening , but I wanted to make my own opinion , and it was unfortunate that a space this huge had one hostess , one manager , one bartender , and five servers at 6 o clock on a Sunday night.

We wanted to spend the day walking outside in a great environment and do some shopping. We wanted to end the day with a little romantic flair and Tanzy delivered.  Tanzy is the restaurant on the second floor of the Scottsdale quarter across from Tru Food. It is connected to the iPic theater. We had a couple of drinks which were all excellent, but the main attraction is the location and ambiance. With one wall open, couches jutting out from inside, and a smokeless fire place this bar oozes a great atmosphere to take someone special.   On the con side, the back to some of the couches are not very comfortable if one does not enlist the help of some of the throw pillows on a neighboring couches. Tanzy please invest some capital into couch cushion technology! All in all a great experience. Be Prepared to pay at least 10 dollars for mixed drinks.

1st of all, this is not an Italian restaurant. Theres very few pasta dishes available. 2nd of all, we went to the grand reopening the other night, and it was fabulous. They had a lot of people staffed and everything went really smoothly. So we decided to come back tonight. Big mistake. Such a Big mistake that we will never ever be back. 1st of all, we made a reservation 3 days ago for 7:00 p.m. tonight. The hostess proceeds to rudely tell us that we had to wait half an hour for a table because there's other people waiting besides us. Mind you, the restaurant was half empty. Then we had to wait an hour and a 1/2 for our food. Yes you heard me right. As we were getting ready to walk out of the restaurant, the manager comes up to us and assures us that the food will be right out. Most of the food was undercooked and cold, and my pasta dish was served on a little side dish and they managed to charge me $13 for it. This place is such a joke. They Have no idea what they're doing or what's going on here. Very very understaffed and very unprofessional.

The tableside mozzarella was delish.  I had the short rib and my husband had the sea bass - both were outstanding!  The pan fried gnocci was so tasty - never had it served that way before.  Even though we were stuffed we couldn't resist trying the red velvet bread pudding - glad we did!!!  Will definitely go back soon.

The bar area is extremely lovely here. If you go for happy hour they have a mini buffet set up with tapas that im pretty sure would fill you up on its own. Every part of the lounging area was beautiful and I would say perfect for a date, girls night, or even just a lonesome venture (which I probably would never do).   A group of girls came here for restaurant week and they had the table set up for us before we arrived. We did lounge at the bar to get a few drinks in before dinner which they happily accommodated. The restaurant menu meals were really good. Just note that the artichokes are fried and the calamari is not. There were a few of us who thought the opposite and ordered accordingly. I would have to say though, the calamari was realllly delicious and i would go back just to eat it again. The artichokes were also good but the amount they gave us (large portions) was way more than enough.   Just to keep things short. My meal was awesome. The restaurant week menu included a wine pairing option so i opted for it just to be adventurous. THE best decision of the night.   I would definitely recommend going for restaurant week..or just any week

The good: Get the table side mozzarella. I thought it was very good, and the choice of seasoning salts is a nice touch. I had the braised beef spare ribs and they were delicious: tender, shredded with a fork, and great flavor. The gnocchi were perfect with a light, fluffy texture and were a great compliment to the garlic spinach. The ambiance was also nice, with dim lighting interwoven with firelight.  The bad: My friend's salmon was just ok. For over $20, it should've been much better.  The ugly: Nothing. Overall, a very nice place.

This is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix...service:  perfect, food: perfect (except for the chicken, which I felt was undercooked and haven't ordered again), ambiance: perfect, location: perfect.  I was there the other night to pick up a to-go order for my mother and sat at the bar for a drink...I ordered a raspberry martini and they didn't have the raspberry, so I was given a free drink while waiting for the food.  I love Phoenix City Grille, and will dine there every chance I get.  The bread pudding is TO DIE FOR!

Came here for my birthday brunch and was very happy with everything. They have a special during brunch for 4 mimosas for $10. The service was great, they were quick to refill our mimosas and since they filled it in front of us, you could see that it was basically a whole flute of champagne and a splash of orange juice - just like I like it. I also tried their bloody mary and it was really really good. I wouldn't recommend it if you don't like your bloody mary spicy because it held a great kick - just like I like it.  About half of us ordered the eggs benedict, and the other half wish they ordered it because it was AMAZING. The eggs were cooked perfectly- with the white cutting like butter and the yolk dripping out with the perfect consistancy-- also the ham and the hollandaise sauce was extremely tasty (all on top of an English muffin).  It came with some home fries which were also delicious. We sat by the window, which they opened for us, it was the perfect whether on a Sunday morning, so that just made the event even better. It is a bit pricey but well worth it if you are in the area.

I had lunch, the food was great.  I had the meatball and prosciutto sandwich, came with a salad. Huge half went home. Also the potatoes with chimichurri sauce, amazing! . Norma Jeane drink was very good too. Staff was very nice and on top of things

I don't like to give 5 stars but this is definitely a 5 star restaurant.  The d√©cor is superb. A trendy atmosphere with modern d√©cor.  Large open windows and incredible food.    I was most impressed by the service and felt compelled to write about my experience.  As a party of four when came to dine at Tanzy for a late lunch which changed over to dinner.  The couple we were with decided on ordering brunch. But my fianc√©e and were in the mood for a more filling meal and so we decided on the dinner menu.    The four of us enjoyed ourselves in conversations and our late afternoon drinks.  Our friend brunch came out first.  And we noticed that dinner meals were taking a bit of time. Then the manager of the restaurant personally came out and apologized for our meals taking so long to prepare.  He said that he will cut our bill a bit.   Shortly afterwards our meals came and it was delicious! When the bill came, we realized that the manager had taken all the food items off the bill and only charged us for drinks! Wow! That was above and beyond expectations!  I am only giving credit where credit is deserved!
Ordered a margarita and found 3 small bugs floating in it. Looked Ike fruit flies. The waitress was nice though. I left without drinking it and of course after that did not want a new one.

This place was pretty average at best. There was nothing actually wrong with our meal (mine at least) but I felt like most dishes were heavy on the salt and my pasta was just OK. We did get the mozzarella sampler to start which was good but rather small for 6 of us to split, but we should've know to get more than one. I don't think I'd return here based on the price of food and the food quality. Nice lounge area when you first walk in with a fire, I would come back for drinks.

I had a great vodka strawberry lemonade! I was going to have lunch but my friend wasn't "feeling" the atmosphere. I think it was quite nice, I like dark elegant settings. I'm anxious to go back next week to try the chicken sandwich they are featuring for some chef contest!!! More to come...

Hand pulled mozzarella (at the table!) with high quality prosciutto was a winner.  Family liked the crab cakes.  My branzino was very good but Israeli cous cous had too much cream, a more Mediterranean take would have been better.  Pappardelle was great.  Daughter loved the filet mignon.  My latte was great but tiramisu was too heavy.  Gelato was super, we had chocolate. The dining room is gorgeous, service was good.  I will return!  Valet parking was convenient

Perfect night out for dinner and drinks! Although a bit pricey, Tanzy is about the same price of other upscale restaurants in Scottsdale. Service was impeccable and food was great. Portions were perfect size and you must try the table side mozzarella appetizers!

Gorgeous restaurant! They spared no expense when designing it. Love the open air windows, firepit, bar area  Definitely this is a place to dress up and people watch the "older" Scts hipsters.  Atmosphere is one of the best in Scottsdale  HOWEVER...  Sadly  My tanzy salad was not so hot.  the lettuce was wilted and the other veggies were definitely old. I ended up getting a bad stomach for several days afterward.  I ordered chicken for the salad which was tasty and a good sized portion. My friends said they liked their food but I didnt hear "delicious" ever come out of their mouths.  One had scallops and the other had the roasted chicken.  If i were to return, i would order the scallops because not only did the plate look gorgeous, the mushrooms and sauce looked wonderful.  THe prices seemed high for the quality of the food.  The service was friendly and especially attentive with the water. The bread was warm and good too.  Id go back for drinks and light apps but not for dinner

Came here late night with a large group for drinks and some food. I really liked the atmosphere with the open space, heat lamps and huge lounge seats.   All of the dishes we ordered looked great. Servings are generous and the prices are right. I had the grilled calamari with artichokes, absolutely fantastic. The calamari were fresh, tender and cooked perfectly.  Drinks are big also!  Service was a little slow, especially on the drinks and considering the place had cleared out for the most part due to the late hour. They actually card at the bar, two thumbs up!   This is good for people watching if you catch a table near the escalators, also a great place for a first date.

Service at the bar area is hit or miss. We had two bartenders waiting on us.  One made our drinks and delivered in record time.  We ordered a few apps and an entree. The apps all came but they completely forgot our entree.  After an hour of waiting we decided to leave.

Highs and lows across the board.  Went for Mothers Day brunch with another couple and kids.  11 of us all together.  The reservation was mistakenly made for 10, so 1 more shouldn't have been a hassle.  However, it took 10 minutes before they could figure out how to add 1 more chair and place setting to the table - so I grabbed a chair and silverware from another table and did it myself.  Depending on what you ordered, the food was either really tasty or really bland.  I ordered the skirtsteak and eggs.  It was under-seasoned and came with no potatoes or other sides.  Eggs were small and unsalted.  My friend ordered the smoked salmon sandwich and raved about it.  I had a taste of it from his plate and agreed that the salmon was very fresh.  The sandwich came with chive cream cheese, capers, red onions on a ciabatta bun.  I should have ordered that!  I also had a taste of the french toast sticks that all the kids ordered (very reasonably priced at $6).  I really liked the way they prepared it.  Deep fried so it was crispy on the outside and a moist on the inside - almost like a bread pudding consistency.  The kicker was the maple syrup with bacon bits mixed in. YUM!  The kids did not enjoy it as much as I did, since they were expecting "traditional" french toast (think IHOP) and the fake syrup that comes out of the bottle.  Can't fault the restaurant for that.  Overall service was prompt, but not very friendly.  Our server was definitely not glad to be working on that day.  The best moment of the day came when the server asked us:  "Would you like some bread for the table?" "Sure," we said, and she came back with 2 lovely presentations of breads and pastries. What she DIDN'T tell us was that each one was $9!!!  Not cool.  Other highlights: The homemade donuts topped with jelly were fantastic. The bloody Mary was very much to my liking as it was loaded with horse radish - jus the way I like it.  My friend did NOT like his for the same reason, so what can you do? The wives enjoyed the mamosas which were a Mother's Day special at 4 for $10.    One major lowlight: I was geeked to see they had chicken and waffles on the menu for brunch.   But, because I've been burned before, I asked the server if the chicken was bone-in or just fried breast meat.  Unfortunatly, it was just a glorified chicken tender.  FAIL!!!!  NOTE TO ALL CHEFS:  If you're going to put chicken and waffles on the menu, it HAS TO BE BONE-IN (see LOLOs Chicken and Waffles for instructions).  The atmosphere was very impressive.  It's a  wide open restaurant on the second floor of the ultra-douchey mall Scottsdale Quarter (if you don't drive a Bentley, why even go there?)  Having said that, the place was very compfortable with a huge bar in the center and an open window-less environment that was perfect for the weather.    Overall, more of a date place than a good spot for Mothers Day.  The service needs some improvement in terms of attitude, but it was prompt and efficient.  The food was generally good, with some great highlights, but the place could be more consistent across the board.  Might go back on date night with the wife to give it another shot and order from the dinner menu.

Tanzy...the good and the bad.  Definitely a good ambiance.    A good place to meet up for drinks before dinner.  The dining room is kind of loud and the front of the restaurant with the couches is a good place to sit if you are just going to have appetizers and drinks.  The server seemed like she was an amateur.   I placed my drink order.  Then she came back and took my date's drink order and our appetizer order.   The appetizer came out before the drinks.  They took away the eaten appetizer dishes and brought out the entr√©e with no cutlery.  We got a chance to stare at our food for a few minutes before the wait staff procured a knife and fork.  I had the fillet and she had the spare rib.  The spare rib was delicious and tender.   The fillet was decent.    I know this place is new, so maybe their wait staff hasn't gotten their act together.  I get really annoyed when servers bring out the food and drink out of sequence.  The food is decent, the place looks swanky, but the service is lacking.  The servers are nice, but they just aren't very accurate.  I would eat here again, but it isn't on the top of my list.  There are a ton of other restaurants in this shopping center that I would try before coming back here.
I dined at Tanzy with 5 others last night. The staff could not have been more accommodating and provided great service. We enjoyed a peaceful and delicious dinner. Thanks!

In a limited one-time visit, Tanzy is upscale in food and mid-range in service.    The menu offers traditional Italian dishes with a variety of meats. As a vegetarian though, I didn't have any trouble finding an option for me. We had a large table for six and everyone was satisfied with their dishes but the service started off inconsistent and got worse as the meal wore on.   The service problems weren't contained within one person - it was pervasive. The host seated the six of us at a table for four before being corrected by another member of the staff. Our drinks seemed to take quite a bit of time and then weren't exactly correct.   Apps and meals were served well but after the meal, the restaurant cleared out and we had a harder time finding our server. We ultimately chose not to order desert because our service dropped off.   The meal was notable though and I'd like to believe the service issues were either a one-time issue or just a state of affairs with the staff that evening. On top of that, we were a large party that came with no advance notice - it would be unfair to award fewer than four stars with these things in mind.
Awesome mozzarella made for you in front of your own eyes. Duck is served too rare if you ask me but all other things were fantastic so I'm giving it a 5 baby!!:))

When here during a special Tuesday with some customers. The drinks were well priced during happy hour. There is an amazing cheese sauce dip creation which is heavenly and they made my food gluten free which was much appreciated. Ladies Tuesday... Strong recommend for the happy house prices.

Another great time at Tanzy!!! Brandon the bartender made me an exceptional old fashion cocktail! My wife had his perfectly pink Cosmopolitan! Loved the service Brandon gave us and we will definitely tell our friends! Thank you for a perfect night!

While in Scottsdale for work, we were looking for some good restaurants, so I hit Yelp and as usual, was not disappointed.  Loved the modern decor and the food was great.  Desserts were very good, although, we were too full at that point to finish them!

Tanzy proved to be a pleasant culinary surprise in the new Scottsdale Quarter shopping complex.   The upstairs, vaulted-ceiling, heavy use of creative metal design throughout has a welcoming and stylish feel. The large bar makes dropping in as a couple very approachable, although a reservation would be prudent for the weekend.    The food is very very good and has a freshness that only quality ingredients can provide. The tagliatelle bolognese comes in a heaping portion and fills you up without leaving you with a heavy pasta dinner feeling. If you're in the mood for a solid pasta meal, I would highly recommend this dish.   The braised beef short rib with goat cheese gnocchi is great, although the flavor profile came up a little short (I would recommend the short ribs at Citizen Public House over what Tanzy had to offer).   While I did not have a custom craft cocktail, I did appreciate the fact that each corner of the bar was equipped with lots of fresh fruit and every flavor of bitters you can imagine. I will be ordering one next time I stop by.   Finally, I always appreciate a bar/restaurant that serves a less  ordinary beer on tap in addition to serving craft cocktails and wine. In this case, I would highly recommend the Racer 5 IPA by Bear Republic Brewery.

I've been in Tanzy for drinks (they definitely have some good ones, but the one I remembered was the ginger sangria - memorable in a bad way. It tasted like patchouli or as my boyfriend put it "this tastes like a hippie").   Anyways, I had always been curious about the food. A couple weeks ago we decided to go in for brunch and caught some of the football games at the bar (a perfect compromise... football/bar for the boyfriend, nice atmosphere and good food for the lady). Our friendly bartender handed us their brunch menu and said he would come back to explain their brunch buffet. I looked at the menu and thought, what??? This is ridiculous! $20 for a standard eggs benedict??? Turns out you can get the brunch only for $14 or you can get a dish + the brunch for the advertised price of that dish. This also includes bottomless mimosas (their fresh squeezed oj was awesome). The buffet has charcuteries, cheeses, hummus, fruit, a variety of pastries and bagels, and a pancake station with at least 10 topping/filling options. I was craving savory, so I ordered the omelet and my boyfriend got the breakfast club sandwich. Both were really good, but so filling I didn't need a lot from the buffet.   To summarize my experience, Tanzy is a beautiful restaurant, has good food and friendly service. And $14-20 for brunch with bottomless mimosas... not too bad.

had my birthday brunch here on sunday. originally I had tried to plan a brunch at my home but I sent my invite last minute and everyone already had plans so we went out instead and it was a wonderful brunch after all. omg i had the best egg white veggie omelet. the veggies inside my omelet were fresh and not over salted. they had an awesome pancake station which I enjoyed. I ordered my pancake with chocolate chips! the mimosas and bloody marys were also a hit. The resto is beautiful and modern and seems like a great place to have drinks.

Stopped into Tanzy on a last minute decision and turned out to be a GREAT choice ! Food was excellent. The brussel sprouts app was friggin fantastic- seriously they were wonderful. I had the risotto which is was so good it inspired me to master my own risotto recipe at home (which i did, if you are wondering). Lova' had the pork and he didn't have any complaints. The beer selection was not the best but i did try a cucumber-limon martini and supa dupa refreshing!

My new favorite place that I never knew existed. I had been to the Scottsdale Quarter to lunch at Brio and True Foods but never knew this place was there. On the second floor. Right- who knew- second floor? It is part of the ipc theater. There is Tanzy the restaurant, Salt, the lounge and then the ipic theater where you can dine and recline while watching a movie and being served. Been to lunch several times and had the proscuitto wrapped asparagus salad which came with mixed greens, red and yellow tomatoes and strawberries drizzled with a balsamic dressing. It also had a set of crostini with a delicious cheese spread on them. I went today with a friend and was looking forward to having it again....and it was gone! WHAT?? So we split the cedar plank salmon with the israeli cous cous and the shrimp/crab cobb salad. All very good! Check out my pictures too.   Great relaxing decor overlooking the water fountains and palm tress swaying on one side and the mountains on the other.

Love this place ! Lisa, Shannon and Carla at the bar are fantastic ! We always stop for a pre-movie visit and beverage!  After the movie we had a Tanzy salad  $8 that was huge and the cedar plank salmon $24 .. it was not busy at the time we were there but it was Tuesday ! This restaurant has always had wonderful food. A certain must is the homemade mozzarella tableside for $18. It is so delicious and a special treat on occasion. Great wine list and happy hour !

Love Love Love Tanzy!!! The bartenders are Awesome!! Shea, Karla & Andy are my faves! They can custom make drinks that aren't on the menu that are completely AmaZing!!! The entire menu is Delicious!!! I'm a sucker for the Tanzy Salad with grilled Chicken and steamed mussels pooh and the Tanzy Burger!!! Everyday is Funday starting with Brunch on Mimosa Sunday's $10/4!!! Tuesday is Penny Martini's yes 1¬¢ martini's No gimmicks!! then Friday and Saturday live DJ. And of course you can watch the game anytime at the bar before you head off to the movies at iPic. What's not to love. Good people, Great Drinks, #FunTimes #Cheers

Went here for lunch the other day with a friend. The food was yum! The portions were generous. Service was great. Our server's name was Blake and he was just sweet as can be.   I can't wait to come back and try it for happy hour because I have heard good things.

My Ribeye steak was cooked perfectly and was full of flavor. Getting the fresh mozzarella at our table was super fun. The Red Velvet Bread Pudding was a fantastic dessert option too (not overly sweet, but very savory).

My wife and I decided to dine here this past Friday night and were very impressed.  Our waitress Michelle was very knowledgable about both the menu and the wine list.  She recommended the short ribs and a really nice pinot noir to go along with my meal, and I absolutely LOVED it.   Michelle informed us that the menu will be changing next week and that we should definitely come back.  Um, yeah, absolutely returning!  My wife's birthday is coming up soon and I am definitely bringing her and friends back for the celebration.   New favorite restaurant.

Struggle with not giving it 2 but can't kill them completely for food we could never ordered and it looked promising. Sat at the 1/2 of the bar that the bartender decided to ignore after dropping off apps and wine.  Ready to reorder 2 wines and 2 entrees, we decided to leave after 20 min of empty glasses and plates.  Maybe will come back, but to much other competition to make it back any time soon.

WOW!  What an amazing experience at this restaurant!!!  My wife and I went to a movie and stopped in the bar for a quick couple drinks.  We initailly stood at the end of the bar for quite a while and were never noticed as new customers but everyone was busy so I don't hold that against anyone.   But once we made our way around to a more "popular" part of the bar, the bartender, Danny, was all over us.  The one thing I liked about this guy is that no matter how busy he was, he was down-to-earth, made us feel that he was paying attention and truely wanted to take care of us.  I ordered what he referred to as an Icepick (I think) which is essentially an Arnold Palmer with vodka and my wife ordered a water.  There was a female co-worker of his who ensured things were good and even checked on my wife's tiramisu when she saw it was taking a while to come out.  Everything about this place was appealing - the ambience, the decor, the menu, the patios and firepits and most importantly, the service.  In fact, I mentioned to my wife that when I open my restaurant, I want it to look and feel the way Tanzy does.  I just finished writing a negative review about Brio and my recommendation is that Tanzy hold a "how to treat your customers" class.  If that happened, every restaurant in that complex would be top notch.  Thank you to the entire staff we dealt with for caring!!!  We will be back!!!

The husband and I went to Tanzy for the Breakfast Club UYE, and it was lovely! The restaurant is beautiful, very large and decorated nicely. The service was great, attentive, accommodating of our large party and of the husband and I's special requests... it was nice. The husband and I both had the brunch prix fixe, which is a decent deal at 22$ for a mimosa, a side/dessert and an entree. The boca mimosas were delicious.... a mimosa with passion fruit and blood orange juices.... this was a fabulous drink, order it, love it. The husband had the waffle with bacon (and it was a large side of bacon) and he thought it was just ok. I had the eggs benedict and subbed bacon for the ham and it was delicious. The eggs were perfectly cooked, the hollandaise was chipotle flavored (or something) and had wonderful spice, and the bacon was crispy and well seasoned (it had red pepper flake and other seasonings on it). The benedict came with breakfast potatoes (and that didn't count as the side), and they were good... crispy and cooked with peppers and onions... liked that. For my side/dessert I got the red velvet bread pudding and ended up getting it to go (I was so full and had somewhere to be).... even the next day, this was a yummy dessert... maybe not my favorite dessert ever, but good. I would consider coming here again for brunch... but they don't open until 11, which is WAY too late (for me). Maybe lunch? Yes. Anyway, if you're a late riser, check this out!

For the high price, I think the food is just ok. Nothing I had there was great, only the waiter, Ivan! We had some prosciutto, which was good, but unusually salty. The bread was toasted, but tasted stale. Meatballs were ok, and scallops were alright. Caesar salad needed a lot of salt, very bland.

I would like to update this post and say management has been very kind and attentive. They addressed my concerns and even sent me a gift card. Talk about a great team!   I feel like I have given this place so many chances and they just continually fail to impress. I've been here twice for brunch and their food is mediocre. The presentation is good and it always looks like it should taste better than it does.   I went today for lunch and ordered the quinoa and goat cheese salad with chicken. The chicken was really over cooked and dry. The lettuce was limp, I believe due to how much dressing was on it, however it was hard to tell because he dressing had almost no flavor to it. One thing that was actually pretty great was the goat cheese. It's a medallion that is encrusted with almonds, fried (I think) and drizzled with a balsamic vinegar glaze. Fabulous!   Long story short, I won't ever go here again unless I have to. There are just too many restaurants on this block to be stuck with sub-par food.

Love this restaurant. I came here for my boyfriends birthday and both of us had never been. We had incredible service. I wish I can remember the name of my server but she was awesome. I was in the mood to try a new wine and she brought out testers for every wine I said I was interested in. I even told her no it's ok and she said no try them first! Same with my boyfriend he didn't know what beer to get and she brought out a few to try. She went out of her way for us even though it was a busy night. We had great tasting food and at the end of the night they brought out a dessert and comped it for his birthday. It was such a great experience
Great location.  Total eye candy.

This place is terrible. I wish i could rate the food for you but we couldn't get that far because the service is so terrible. Our waitress dropped off the wrong order to us and then spent the entire night standing over by her friends table. Clearly she was giving them free food which generally I could care less about.  When we asked the bartender for the right drink she sent our waitress over and all we got is attitude.  Theres far too many options at Scottsdale Quarter to deal with this place. 4 drinks for $40 and terrible service, no thanks.

We really love the ambiance at Tanzy, the decor, the tables, the warmth etc.  I tried the pasta bolognese this past weekend, and thought it was especially delicious.  The service was outstanding and we really enjoyed our visit.  The only thing I was bummed about was the cocktails.  I ordered one of the lemon-lime blood orange martinis, and had a difficult time choking it down.  For $11, I think they should use something better than infused Svedka vodka to make the cocktail a little smoother.  At that price point, it should at least be Stoli or Absolut.  Other than that, we thought the food was good and the portions were hefty.

Our group came here last night after dinner at the Persian Room. First time for me at Tanzy, loved it! We got a great area by the fire pit surrounded by couches and ottomans. Ordered after dinner drinks and dessert ( I will have to come for dinner since the menu has many diverse items!)   My drink choice was the spice and ice martini ( a little sweet, a little spice, all amazing!). And for dessert we sampled the red velvet bread pudding (decadent!) and the white chocolate and chambord creme br√ªl√©e ( perfection!). Great way to end the night!!
Their restaurant and drinks are fabulous and the brunch entrees are made to perfection! Fantastic eggs benedict! Kaleb our server was incredibly polite and attentive as well. What a great find!

Do not ever consider hosting an event here unless you get something in writing. We had reserved the room in the back for 40 people. I sent out 375 invitations letting people know about our event at Tanzy. Unfortunately a couple days ago, their catering manager informed me we would be in the lounge. I'm assuming someone more important wanted the space so they had priority. We will be hosting the event  at Dominick's across the street. Where they keep their word on our reservations. I'm sure the food will be better anyway.   Also, another time we ate there with another couple, 1/2 of the stuff we tried to order they were out of!
Delicious food!  Excellent service!

Came here for a date night. The food was overpriced and there was nothing special about our meal. Both of us thought it was bland, I had the branzino and my date had a pasta dish. Tanzy has potential with its beautiful decor, but I wouldn't waste a date night here.

Met family at Tanzy while shopping with my daughter for her birthday at the Quarter.  Lunch was good, portions sizes are generous. My daughter and I both had the Tanzy Salad with Salmon, very tasty, with a good portion of salmon but eat it with caution since there are olives in the salad and not all the olives apparently are pitted. My daughter luckily didn't break a tooth when she bit down on 2 olives with pits still in them which for the birthday girl didn't make for the most comfortable eating experience. We seemed to be the only guests there for brunch so we had our server to ourselves.

Tanzy's update. All I can say is UNBELIEVABLE. From the minute I posted a critical review to the visit last Saturday night, the General Manager and one of his staff members were in frequent, humble and apologetic contact with me.  The GM, Ben, left me his cell number!!!! and asked if we would return and give them the opportunity to demonstrate their high standards of service. My friends had frequented this restaurant MANY times and it was their "go to" place. Having said that, after our disappointing experience in late December they decided they weren't going to return.....ever.  In fact, they felt it was risky to continue to take out of town guests there if ours was the kind of "customer experience" they could expect.  Ben arranged for our visit, came by the table and chatted and checked in with us on a few occasions (but without being intrusive) Our Server, Charlie was just amazing and we followed nearly all of his recommendations.  And Matt, who prepared the table side cheese (mozzarella) was wonderful and VERY knowledgeable about particular unique salts/spices and oil to use for different tastes....if there is such a thing as a "cheese sommelier" Matt is one.  And the experience of the table side preparation is entertaining and informative..  Our food was delicious from the calamari appetizer (best I have EVER had) to the Branzino, Steaks and even the chocolate ganache cake with banana carmel ice cream.  If you have had a less than stellar experience here recently or if you haven't been in awhile, GO BACK! You will be so impressed with the attention to detail, the informative and warm servers, the excellent food and ambiance.  Huge thanks again to Tanzy's.  My friends will most certainly return and we were all were thrilled to have such a memorable meal.

Well, this experience was interesting. We walked up asked the host if there was anything available he said 30 minutes. We decided to sit at the bar and have a drink. Before we sat at the bar I asked the 16 year old taking names if i could put my name down just in case we wanted to sit at a table. She asked if I had a reservation. Uhm No. She said there was nothing available. By the way it was only 7:30pm. We found 2 seats at the bar. Behind us was about 7 open tables. Hmm nothing available? After about 10 minutes finally one of the 6 bartenders noticed us. My wife asked for a blueberry press - No blueberry vodka. Then she asked for Captain - Uhm no Captain. Finally an orange press. Clearly the bartender had no idea how to make one. I just saw Makers behind him, so to play it safe I asked for Makers. Didn't want to confuse him.   After this we decided that we would only order an appetizer. Dinner might seem too painful. So we ordered the Grilled Calamari. I have to say it was amazing. The Calamari was thick and grilled perfectly the artichokes and everything were delicious. We actually thought maybe we should just order dinner. Then the 15 minute wait until the bartender asked us if we were ok - so Check please!  From just having that one appetizer I have to say the food is great. The service on all ends was terrible. Not sure if I will attempt again.
Loved our dinner at Tanzy!  The white fish with lobster and summer squash was amazing!  And the cheesecake topped with chocolate is a must!  Friendly fast service.  Loved it!

OMG. Soooooooo good.  Things you must try while here.... 1. Table side mozzarella. Appetizer for 2. Divine. Seriously, really effing good. I'm not kidding.  2. The grilled bone in pork chop. It's a meal for two unless you're VERY hungry. Now I for one am a guy that likes chunks of meat with a bone sticking out of it. This chop nails it.   Beautiful restaurant. Fantastic food. Server was AMAZEBALLS. He had a brain fart tho. (Wrote that in there for his benefit, good job Tyler. Thanks for the oranges)   All in all, go here. Eat. Then tell me I was right.

The atmosphere here gets a 5/5 stars. The place is very nice for a date or a night out with the girls. There's a bar area with Lounge seating and a fire. The back of the restaurant has a huge wine room that's very impressive. The restaurant is quiet and dark and relaxing for a night out. We ordered the Wagyu steak and the scallops with the table side mozzarella to start. Everything was amazing and delicious. This was our second time visiting and this visit everything tasted a lot better than our first visit. They've made changes to the food and the menu for the better! Our meal was fantastic and the service was super friendly as well!
